article_summary:
These measures largely involve changes to the West Virginia Medical Professional Liability Act (MPLA), the law governing suits against health care providers in West Virginia.
Saturday, April 4, 2015During its recent 2015 session, the West Virginia Legislature passed significant tort reform measures impacting Long Term Care (LTC) providers.
Please see the attached summary of the MPLA changes for more information, as well as the attachedfull text of Senate Bill 6, which contains the verbatim changes to the MPLA.
These changes are clearly helpful to LTC providers in West Virginia, but they apply only to actions filed after July 1, 2015.
Paul “Kip” Reese worked during the session as a committee lawyer at the West Virginia Legislature, and was therefore intimately involved in helping the legislators analyze and write many of the changes to the MPLA.
